page.title: 07Shops in Butterton
page.content: In Butterton, there are several shops - a general store, a butcher's shop, a post office and a small shop which sells sweets and drinks and acts as a tea-room. The general store sells tinned and frozen food, fresh vegetables and fruit, drinks, papers and stationery. The owner also delivers orders and papers to nearby villages. He stocks up weekly, on Mondays from the Potteries, and with fresh produce from Leek on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The butcher's shop has a wide range of meat. They also have a van which travels to local villages selling meat. Four people work at the shop. They slaughter about 5 cows and 15 sheep every Monday. Both shops are open every day from 9a.m. until 5 or 6p.m.
